Ad Text:
I’m working with a major Australian enterprise undertaking a large-scale AI uplift, and we’re looking for a senior hands-on engineer to lead the build of a new, unified AI platform. This is a greenfield initiative designed to give data science and analytics teams a secure, scalable environment for ML experimentation, GenAI development, and enterprise-grade model deployment. 

Length: 6 months rolling (Long-term program)
Location: Sydney (Hybrid) 

What You’ll Do
Lead the end-to-end build and operationalisation of a centralised AI/ML platform, supporting rapid experimentation and scalable production usage across ML and GenAI.
Deliver iterative releases and continuously evolve the platform in response to user needs and emerging capability requirements.
Build and integrate key components across ML development tooling, GenAI/prompt engineering environments, and enterprise inference services.
Develop core platform engineering assets - IaC, CI/CD pipelines, architecture documentation, standards, operational runbooks, and reusable patterns.
Provide senior technical leadership across AWS-native services (SageMaker, Bedrock, S3, RDS, Teradata) and modern AI/ML platform architectures.
Translate high-level concepts into detailed technical designs, execution plans, and actionable engineering backlog items.
Support adoption by onboarding data science and analytics teams, ensuring strong performance, governance, observability, and cost efficiency.
Collaborate across Product, Security, Architecture, Cloud, and Data teams while mentoring engineers and promoting engineering excellence.
What You’ll Bring
10+ years’ experience building and operating large-scale data, AI/ML, or cloud platforms in complex enterprise environments.
Strong AWS expertise, especially SageMaker, Bedrock, S3, IAM, and modern DevOps/MLOps tooling.
Proven ability to design and deliver secure, governed, cost-efficient AI/ML platform capabilities.
Hands-on experience with IaC (Terraform/CloudFormation) and CI/CD automation.
Experience establishing platform engineering standards and reusable patterns in greenfield or early-stage AI initiatives.
Ability to lead technical delivery end-to-end while mentoring and uplifting engineering teams.
Skilled at converting high-level architecture and product requirements into actionable technical plans.
Familiarity with GenAI/LLM tooling and prompt engineering (advantageous).
Strong communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.
AWS or relevant DevOps/MLOps certifications highly regarded.
If you want to shape platform foundations from the ground up while still driving hands-on delivery, this is that kind of role.

If you have any questions about this role or others we have available you can email our team directly via data@thedrivegroup.com.au 

For The Latest Jobs, Tech News or to 'Introduce A Friend' for a $1000 Referral Fee - Follow Us On Linkedin:

https://www.linkedin.com/company/thedrivegroup

TheDriveGroup is 100% committed to improving meaningful diversity in the technology industry.

We partner with clients who embrace diversity and seek candidates across all backgrounds, abilities, genders, sexualities, cultures, and faiths.

If you have the right skills and attitude we would love to hear from you!

You will provide customer support and engineering through the performance of small projects, on-site installation, and troubleshooting, service, and repair of equipment. The Field Service Engineers work with our customers to maintain a thoughtful and productive manufacturing system.




We ask that you have vision, creativity, technical engineering expertise, and a willingness to travel. Ensure that the individual parts of a system can work together to perform the desired application. Take ownership of the complete system or solution, which encompasses RA, third-party, and user aspects, not only the individual components. Be able to increase the application of all RA family of products and portfolio offerings to meet customer's needs.




Your Responsibilities:

Attend to field service work.

Provide technical assistance and field service to customers by performing one or more of the following things.

Engineering assistance application, programming specifications, etc.

Field service installation start-up integration, system optimization, maintenance, and warranty implementation.

Troubleshoot hardware and software problems at customer site

Provide customer coordination of RA products and systems by performing the following function.

On-site analysis and specification preparation.

Hardware configuration – system and product application.

Programming assistance.

Project coordination between customer, OEM sales, product division, etc

Technical support – field start-up, integration and maintenance.

Documentation




The Essentials - You Will Have:

Hold a valid Australian electrical license. Additional tertiary education or university degree is highly advantageous.

5+ years engineering and/or field experience

Proven experience with industrial drive systems, including VSD/VFD, LV/MV AC Drives (preferably Rockwell Automation / Allen Bradley)

Strong communication skills with the ability to convey technical concepts clearly.

Capability to deliver technical presentations to both internal teams and external customers.

Skilled in building and maintaining relationships with key customers and stakeholders.

Demonstrated active listening & teamwork skills

Professional, enthusiastic, customer-focused, and a strong team player.

Results-driven with a collaborative mindset.




The Preferred - You Might Also Have:

Experience collaborating with sales team and customers

Excellent presentation and interpersonal communication abilities.

Ability to engage in consultative and constructive dialogue with customers and internal teams.

Knowledge of PLC systems and networks is highly advantageous.




What We Offer:

Our benefits package includes …

Comprehensive mindfulness programs with a premium membership to Calm

Volunteer Paid Time off available after 6 months of employment for eligible employees

Company volunteer and donation matching program – Your volunteer hours or personal cash donations to an eligible charity can be matched with a charitable donation.

Employee Assistance Program

Personalized wellbeing programs through our OnTrack program

On-demand digital course library for professional development

... and other local benefits!




At Rockwell Automation we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right person for this or other roles.




#LI-Hybrid #LI-CT1

Job Title: Cyber Security Engineer - SIEM AI Automation
Ad Text:
We’re looking for a Cyber Security Engineer who loves building smart automations and working with the latest Microsoft security tools—especially Microsoft Sentinel and Copilot for Security.  This is a hybrid contract role working with a growing large national corporate with an office in Melbourne CBD, starting in January 2026.

What you'll do

Build and improve automated workflows and playbooks in Sentinel.
Use Copilot to speed up investigations, threat hunting, and SOC tasks.
Create analytics rules, KQL queries, and integrations with other security tools.
Help the team work smarter by automating repetitive security processes.
What we're after

Solid experience with Microsoft Sentinel or similar enterprise SIEM tools.
Familiarity with Copilot for Security or similar AI-driven tools.
Good understanding of SOC operations, detections, and incident response.
Why join us?

Very competitive daily contract rates
Work with modern Microsoft security tech.
Hybrid WFH / Office in Melbourne CBD
Flexible and supportive team and management.
If you’re CyberSec Engineer who’s into automation, AI-assisted security, and making security operations more efficient, we’d love to hear from you!  Please apply now for a quick response and more information!

About Us 

Future Secure AI (FSAI) is a leading enterprise AI company that was created in deep partnership with one of the world's largest financial institutions.

Operating as an enterprise company with deep relationships at C-suite with large global enterprises, FSAI believes humans and AI Workers will collaborate seamlessly to raise organisational performance. FSAI has dozens of partnerships with leading companies in most industries and regions globally.

FSAI has a strategic focus on expanding globally as we continue our extraordinary journey to transform the world with the most cutting-edge artificial intelligence.

The Opportunity

We are hiring Senior AI Engineers (Software) to help us build the product and platform. In this role, you’ll lead customer-facing engagements, collaborating closely with customer and partner technical teams, alongside our internal squad to enhance tech solutions. 

This role requires you to efficiently navigate between detailed coding and broader business and product strategies. You must be highly organised, adept in cross-functional teams, and passionate about advancing AI technology.

Key responsibilities

Enable enterprise customers to deploy a diverse and dynamic range of AI agents from multiple third-party platforms (including models, LLMs, micro-services and even orchestration layers) through their own secure and scalable platform.

Develop innovative AI products for reputable global clients, focusing on Node.js, and integrating AI with use of LangChain, LangGraph, Flowise

Discover and incorporate new partnerships, products, and technologies, including cutting-edge LLMs and AI models, from both established and emerging vendors.

Design and implement algorithms specifically for AI agents, utilizing your Node.js expertise and understanding of AI frameworks.

Strategize on the seamless integration of new features and APIs across various platforms in large-scale enterprise environments, leveraging your Node.js and potential Python skills.

Exhibit a deep commitment to understanding user needs and meticulous attention to detail, ensuring our solutions not only meet but exceed user expectations.

Uphold and exceed enterprise-grade compliance standards, such as SOC2, ensuring our products are secure and reliable.

Requirements

Ideally you bring at least 7 years of software development experience; preferably with knowledge of AI concepts including natural language processing, machine learning, and neural networks. 

Not only do you have impressive problem-solving skills, we also value your leadership mindset and ability to proactively take charge in a fast moving environment. 

To be successful you must demonstrate the following:

Strong background in Node.js development is a must. Python is a plus.

Strong background in LangChain, AI Agent frameworks, and ability to apply these advanced AI solutions, OR you’re passionate about learning this (we will train you!)

Strong experience in building secure, scalable APIs.

Strong understanding of cloud environments (Azure, AWS, GCP)

Impressive problem solving / analytical skills

Impeccable attention to detail and integrity in your work ethic, you follow-through on doing what you said you’ll do.

Bonus

Experience with orchestration applications like Flowise 

Proficiency in CICD, Kubernetes and containerization technologies

If you're passionate about working with cutting-edge technology, collaborating with world-class leadership, and joining some of the best talent in the industry, we’d love to hear from you!

For a quicker response, we encourage you to apply directly through our website at https://www.futuresecure.ai/. There, you can watch a video about AI workers and explore the career opportunities we have available.

Job Title: Principal Data Engineer - 6 Months Contract - AWS SageMaker
Ad Text:
Principal Data Engineer  - 6 Months Contract - AWS SageMaker

About the company
Our client is a major Australian enterprise undergoing significant AI-driven transformation. The organisation is scaling its data and AI capability, investing in modern platforms, and building future-ready foundations to enable secure, enterprise-wide AI innovation.

About the role
This Principal Data Engineer role leads the hands-on build of a new AI and ML platform. Reporting to a Product Owner and working in a small cross-functional team, it drives platform engineering, architecture, delivery, and user enablement across the enterprise.

Benefits

Competitive daily rate
High-impact greenfield program
Opportunity to set enterprise AI platform standards
Flexible ways of working
Work with modern cloud-native technologies and emerging AI capability
Duties / Key responsibilities

Lead the build and operationalisation of the AI Workbench platform
Develop CI/CD, IaC, architecture artefacts, and scalable platform components
Provide technical leadership across cloud-native AI/ML services
Support user onboarding, platform adoption, optimisation, and performance
Mentor engineers and collaborate across architecture, security, and product teams
Skills and experience

10+ years delivering large-scale data and AI/ML platforms
Expertise across AWS (SageMaker, Bedrock, S3, IAM) and cloud-native engineering
Strong skills in Terraform/CloudFormation and CI/CD
Experience establishing platform engineering standards in greenfield environments
Ability to translate architecture into actionable technical design
Strong collaboration, communication, and problem-solving skills
Familiarity with LLMs, GenAI tooling, and prompt engineering (desirable)
AWS or DevOps/ML Ops certifications (desirable)
If you’re interested in this opportunity and feel you’re the right fit please click “apply” 

About Allura Partners
Allura Partners was founded to support private equity firms by placing C-Suites to lead, transform, and scale portfolio companies. Today, in addition to our proven private equity specialisation, we’ve become a trusted partner for major ASX-listed and private enterprises in Australia, offering executive search, recruitment, and business transformation. Known for integrity, reliability, and results, our expertise spans Executive Search, Accounting & Finance, Transformation & Change, and Technology & Digital. We connect businesses and top-tier talent, exceeding expectations and driving lasting impact.

6 Months Contract - Principal Data Engineer - AWS SageMaker

Job Title: Infrastructure Engineer - Technology Operations & Automation Engineer
Ad Text:
The Company

Fortune 500 Company. Fast growing, dynamic organisation, dedicated to the development of its people.

Our organisation is actively committed to Innovation. Team members throughout our business live the Innovation Behaviours. This fosters an Innovation culture where new skills are learnt, ideas are shared and opportunities are created as we strive for better outcome. 

The Opportunity

We are seeking a hands-on Infrastructure Engineer to join our dynamic team at Berkley Insurance Company. This role blends the responsibilities of Technology Operations and Automation Engineering, making it ideal for candidates with strong on-premise experience, particularly in SQL database support, scripting (PowerShell, .Net), and automation.

As an Infrastructure Engineer, you will play a key role in building and maintaining robust enterprise systems across our infrastructure. You’ll contribute to operational reliability, system administration, and automation initiatives that support our secure and highly available technology environment. This is a great opportunity to make a real impact by strengthening and evolving the backbone of our enterprise systems and operations.

What You’ll Be Doing

Database Support: Partner with our DBA team to maintain and enhance MS SQL environments.

Champion Automation: Design and support automated workflows, job scheduling, and DevOps tooling to boost efficiency and reduce manual effort.

Environment Management: Administer and support a range of systems including ERP platforms, core business applications, and Atlassian tools.

Performance & Reliability: Monitor system health, troubleshoot issues, and ensure high availability across environments.

Cross-Team Collaboration: Work closely with development, infrastructure, and network teams to deliver seamless, scalable solutions.

Documentation & Process Improvement: Keep our tech playbooks sharp and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives.

Secure Deployments: Participate in change management and deployment activities with a focus on governance and compliance.

Audit & Reporting: Support regulatory, compliance, and audit reporting requirements.

The successful candidate

Essential:

Tertiary qualification in Computer Science or a related field

5+ years’ hands-on experience in Infrastructure engineering or systems administration

Solid technical skills across Windows environments

Strong knowledge of MS SQL Server and administration and backup processes

Proficiency in scripting (PowerShell, Bash) for automation.

Experience with managing and supporting ERP systems and business-critical applications

A natural problem-solver with excellent communication and collaboration skills

Desired:

Exposure to Cloud platforms (Azure) with relevant certifications

Automation frameworks, and monitoring tools (e.g. SolarWinds, Foglight)

Understanding of Atlassian tools, SDLC, ITIL or similar service management frameworks

Want to know more about Berkley Insurance Company

https://berkleyinaus.com.au/

https://www.berkleyre.com/anz/

https://berkleyasia.com/

https://www.berkleyre.com/asia/

Everything Counts. Everyone Matters.

The successful applicant will be provided with a competitive remuneration and benefits package and an excellent platform for growth and development.

Apply in confidence with CV and covering letter.

***NO AGENCIES***

OVERVIEW OF SMILING MIND 

Smiling Mind has been at the forefront of mental wellbeing innovation for over 12 years, helping minds thrive with evidence-based tools and resources. We’re proud to have impacted the lives of millions of people globally.

Our mission is Lifelong Mental Fitness. We aim to create generational change in mental health, providing proactive tools and programs that help every mind thrive. So far, we’ve reached more than 9.3 million people through our renowned mental fitness app and more than 14 million young people through our app and school based programs - but this is just the beginning.




ROLE OVERVIEW

We’re looking for a hands-on, curious and future-focused data engineer to join our growing product team. Your role is to help us:

Manage and evolve our internal data pipelines and metrics systems

Build tools and automation to reduce ad hoc data wrangling

Generate meaningful insights to support educators, researchers and funders

Lay the foundations for more scalable, self-serve and AI-enabled reporting

You’ll work closely with the product, research and commercial teams — and play a key part in transforming how data supports strategy and impact at Smiling Mind.




KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Data Pipelines & Infrastructure

Build and maintain reliable ELT/ETL pipelines across product analytics (e.g. Amplitude), app backend, CRM (Hubspot), surveys (Qualtrics) and support tools (Freshdesk)

Use tools like dbt, Alteryx, or custom scripts (e.g. Replit or GenAI wrappers) to transform and standardise data

Maintain and enhance our BigQuery warehouse as a trusted, well-governed source of truth

Implement and monitor data quality rules, lineage, observability and retention policies

Automation & Self-Service

Collaborate with the COO and product team to build AI-assisted internal tools (e.g. MetricsGPT) that reduce data bottlenecks and support self-serve insights

Identify manual reporting tasks and automate them thoughtfully with an emphasis on accuracy, transparency and maintainability

Insights & Storytelling

Work closely with research and commercial teams to surface insights for school programs, grants, philanthropic funders and strategic partnerships

Translate complex datasets into clear, credible narratives and visualisations

Support product and strategy teams with dashboards, funnel analysis, retention tracking and program impact metrics




TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS

Proficiency with SQL and BigQuery (or similar warehouses)

Experience with dbt, Alteryx, or data orchestration tools (Airflow, Dagster)

Familiar with Amplitude

Familiarity with APIs and custom data integrations (e.g. Amplitude, Hubspot, Qualtrics)

Knowledge of data observability, testing and quality frameworks

Interest in using GenAI tools to reduce data grunt work and enable insight creation

Bonus: familiarity with Looker Studio, Metabase, Replit, or scripting languages (Python/JavaScript)




MINDSET AND CAPABILITIES 

You’re curious, love to learn, and excited about emerging tools and AI-enabled workflows

You’re comfortable with ambiguity and can help bring structure to evolving needs

You care about impact, ethics, and using data responsibly

You love making data useful, trustworthy, and beautiful




THE VALUES WE LIVE BY AT SMILING MIND

100% People-first: We are dedicated to creating impact with people at the centre of everything we do. 

Change-makers: We challenge the status quo and pave new paths towards helping every mind thrive.

Curious: We ask questions and we strive to keep learning and improving. 

Intentional: We know action is required to achieve our goals and we’re purposeful in every action we take.




WE LOVE PEOPLE WHO HAVE

A belief in the purpose and philosophy of Smiling Mind - that we can achieve generational change in mental health by focusing on building mental fitness skills in young people and the adults that surround them

A desire to have a positive impact on the world – particularly through behaviour change and learning design

The ability to blend agility and pace, with the rigour required to deliver impactful health services

A growth mindset and willingness to learn

Attention to detail, accountability, and ability to work to timelines and manage competing tasks

A warm, friendly, collaborative, and engaging approach 

Alignment to our values 

We're a friendly and highly driven small team with a big dream so expect to be surrounded by people who are passionate about changing the future generations of Australians. 'Smart Hustle' is a state of mind in a not-for-profit, but we are certainly not your standard. Smiling Mind is a high growth, fast paced organisation more akin to a tech start-up than what you might perceive a not-for-profit to be like.

Our people have tenacity, creativity, and resilience in spades, meaning we punch well above our weight, working together as a tight knit team to achieve great things.

You will be supported to succeed, but encouraged  to use initiative to get the job done, will be challenged to perform at your very best, and in return get the opportunity to learn from inspiring and skilled team members achieving life changing results for our community.

Other perks include a hybrid work environment, your birthday off each year, planned development days each quarter, salary sacrificing and a Collingwood based warehouse office which is most definitely dog friendly.

Smiling Mind is a child safe organisation and is committed to ensuring the safety and wellbeing of all children, at all times. All offers of employment are subject to satisfactory background checks including, but not limited to, Working with Children Check and Referee Checks.

All employees are required to adhere to Smiling Mind's Code of Conduct, Policies & Procedures, and relevant Clinical & Technical Governance frameworks. Additionally, all activities must comply with the National Digital Mental Health Standards to ensure safe, ethical, and high-quality service delivery and operational integrity.

We are committed to creating a workplace that promotes mutual learning, respect, dignity, cultural openness and an appreciation of differing perspectives and backgrounds. We encourage applications from all people regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, cultural background, or sexual orientation. It is our goal that Smiling Mind continues to evolve as a culturally safe and welcoming organisation to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander children, young people, families, and communities. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply for this position.

Job Title: Mainframe Automation Infrastructure Specialist- 12 month contract
Ad Text:
A major bank is currently seeking a Mainframe Automation Infrastructure Specialist to join their team on an initial 12 month contract highly likley to extend

Role can be based in Sydney/ Melbourne/ Adelaide or Canberra!!

The role plays an important role in the development and maintenance of technical solutions within the Mainframe and ensures that the detailed design and operations are fit for purpose. 

Key Skills/ Experience :

Experience in installing, customizing, and maintaining Broadcom CA OPS/MVS, Broadcom CA SOLVE, SOLVE NetMaster, and SOLVE SSI Operations
Full understanding of IBM Z Systems and Operations.
Mainframe configuration
System Performance and Optimisation
Experience with installing, customising and maintaining IBM Z System Automation
Experience with installing, customising and maintaining IBM Z Netview.
Knowledge of other system products such as z/OS, IMS, CICS, DB2.
Proven ability to design, code, test, document and implement complex programs/scripts in a Mainframe Automation product- desirable
 
If interested please respond ASAP with your latest resume

12+12 month contract - WFH Flexibility
Baseline Security Clearance required
Experience in Veeam Backup and Replication

Our client, a Federal Government department, is seeking an Infrastructure Engineer who specialises in Automation and Virtualisation to support its objectives over the engagement period. 

Key duties and responsibilities for the Senior Automation Infrastructure Engineer:

Develop the Department's Aria Automation, NSX, Aria Operations & Site Recovery Manager;
Maintain and enhance the Department's VMWare vSphere, Cloud Foundation environments and server infrastructure;
Manage data centres, virtualisation, automation, storage, backup and restore capability;
Produce design, build and operations documents for processes and procedures.

Skills and Experience require:

Demonstrated experience in Aria Platform such as Aria Automation, Aria Orchestrator, and Aria Operations;
Extensive experience in VMWare NSX;
Demonstrated scripting and coding experience in PowerShell, PowerCLI, YAML and JavaScript.

How to Apply

For a copy of the full job description, including the application instructions, please get in touch with Chloe at Recruitment Hive by clicking the Quick Apply button. Alternatively you can reach Chloe on (02) 6299 1006 to discuss further.

Please note that applications close on Friday the 19th December 2025 at 11am. Recruitment Hive welcome late applications to be considered for future opportunities.

Job ID: CB657533 | LH-04903

We Value Diversity

The Recruitment Hive is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer. We recognise the value of diverse perspectives and experience and are committed to an inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected for who they are. We encourage people with disability, indigenous, veterans and people of all backgrounds and abilities to express their interest in this role.

As a Data Modeler, you will be responsible for establishing and maintaining the conceptual, logical, and physical data models that drive our client's Dynamics 365 CRM, Dataverse, and Microsoft Fabric environments. You will develop canonical models, define entity relationships, set metadata standards, and ensure our data assets seamlessly integrate across business units, platforms, and enterprise applications.

You’ll work closely with a D365 Solutions Architect and collaborate with cross-functional teams, ensuring the data layer is scalable, coherent, and aligned with long-term architectural goals.

Key Responsibilities:
Data Modelling & Architecture:
Design and maintain data models for Dataverse, Dynamics 365 CRM, and Fabric Lakehouse/Warehouse.
Define canonical entities and shared schemas across CRM, F&O, and integration points.
Establish naming conventions, relationship patterns, attribute standards, and metadata definitions.
Define organisational boundary attributes to support RBAC and cross-organisation data isolation.
Integration & Interoperability
Develop source-to-target mappings for CRM ↔ F&O, CRM ↔ external systems, and CRM ↔ Fabric pipelines.
Define API payloads, event schemas, and transformation logic with the Solutions Architect.
Document lineage, integration contracts, and versioning standards.
Support Azure integration teams with schema guidance and validation rules.
Analytics & Fabric Enablement
Ensure CRM data models support BI and ML workloads within Microsoft Fabric.
Collaborate with analytics teams to refine star schemas, semantic models, and medallion architecture.
Define data quality rules and exception thresholds at the attribute level.
Governance & Documentation
Develop and maintain data dictionaries, ERDs, metadata catalogues, and domain definitions.
Ensure alignment with governance frameworks and data protection requirements.
Support application of sensitivity labels, retention tags, and lifecycle rules across CRM entities.
Contribute to the enterprise glossary and multi-level domain model.
Stakeholder Engagement
Lead workshops to validate data definitions, flows, and integration dependencies.
Advise delivery teams, vendors, and product owners on data modelling standards.
Maintain close alignment with the D365 Solutions Architect across all workstreams.
Skills & Experience Required:
Proven expertise modelling enterprise data for Dynamics 365 / Dataverse.
Experience developing canonical models and schemas in multi-system environments.
Hands-on experience with Microsoft Fabric, semantic modelling, and Common Data Model mapping.
Strong understanding of metadata management, data classification, retention, and governance.
Familiarity with Azure integration technologies (APIM, Logic Apps, Functions).
Ability to produce ERDs, lineage documentation, and data dictionaries.
Excellent communication skills for architecture reviews and cross-vendor collaboration.

What's on offer?

$900 - $1,000 p/d
Initial 6-month contract.
Hybrid/ Flexible work environment (nearby Melbourne CBD location).
